gobblin.instrumented

Interface Instrumentable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsyncWriterManager, EventBasedExtractor, FineGrainedWatermarkTracker, Instrumented, InstrumentedConverter, InstrumentedConverterDecorator, InstrumentedDataWriter, InstrumentedDataWriterDecorator, InstrumentedExtractor, InstrumentedExtractorBase, InstrumentedExtractorDecorator, InstrumentedForkOperator, InstrumentedForkOperatorDecorator, InstrumentedPartitionedDataWriterDecorator, InstrumentedRowLevelPolicy, InstrumentedRowLevelPolicyDecorator

    public interface Instrumentable
    Interface for classes instrumenting their execution into a MetricContext.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getMetricContext

        @Nonnull
MetricContext getMetricContext()
        Get MetricContext containing metrics related to this Instrumentable.
        Returns:
        an instance of MetricContext.

      • isInstrumentationEnabled

        boolean isInstrumentationEnabled()
        Returns true if instrumentation is activated.
        Returns:
        true if instrumentation is enabled, false otherwise.

      • generateTags

        List<Tag<?>> generateTags(State state)
        Generate tags that should be added to the MetricContext.
        Returns:
        List of tags to add to MetricContext.

      • switchMetricContext

        void switchMetricContext(List<Tag<?>> tags)
        Generate a new MetricContext replacing old Tag with input Tag (only tags with the same keys will be replaced), and recreate all metrics in this new context.

        This method is useful when the state of the Instrumentable changes and the user wants that state change to be reflected in the tags of the instrumentation.

        Notice that this method creates a brand new MetricContext and Metric every time it is called, with the associated processing and memory overhead. Use sparingly only for state changes that must be visible in emitted metrics.

        Parameters:
        tags - additional Tag.

      • switchMetricContext

        void switchMetricContext(MetricContext context)
        Switches the existing MetricContext with the supplied metric context and regenerates Metric.

        This method is useful when the state of the Instrumentable changes and the user wants that state change to be reflected in the set of Tag of the instrumentation.

        This method is an alternative to switchMetricContext(List) when metric context switching is done often between a small set of contexts. The subclass should keep a list of previously generated contexts as a cache, and call this method to simply switch between the different contexts, avoiding the overhead of generating a brand new context every time a metric context switch is required.

        Parameters:
        context - new MetricContext.
